Option 1: Star Man boarded the raft and began rowing toward the Geefork Republic.

Three hours later the shore was gone; sea spread in every direction. To Star Man
the ocean felt not like a rich cradle but a realm of death.

If he over‑exerted he'd collapse, so he kept rowing with brief pauses. Soaked
and pitching, he couldn't sleep—if he did he'd drift—so he chose to row on
without rest.
